div.ab: rāspīg pad gāh ī hāwanān: cod., Anklesaria, Geldner, Kotwal and Boyd.

Commentary.ab: However, ms. 672 [K6] lʾspyk.YMRRWN-yt PWN gʾs plbltʾl; Geldner, 1886-1996, p.37, n.2.1 "according to J3 at the Frabartār's place".
Y8.3a †haŋhāna] for haŋhanāna Kellens, 1984, p. 425. Cf. Yt13.88 haŋhanānāi.

Parallels.ab: miiazdəm yōi dim haŋhāna aṣ̌āca frə̄rətica ~ Y44.18 kaϑā aṣ̌ā tat̰ mīždəm hanānī.

Nerangs.ab: rāspīg pad gāh ī hāwanān xᵛarata narō aētəm miiazdəm
"The rāspīg at the place of the hāwanān (says): xᵛarata narō aētəm miiazdəm"
rāspīg gōwēd pad gāh ī frabardār xᵛarata narō aētəm miiazdəm
"The rāspīg says at the place of the frabardār: xᵛarata narō aētəm miiazdəm."

Quotations.ab: pad aṣ̌aiia.nō paiti.jamiiāt̰ hāwanān ul ō pāy estišn u-š xᵛarata narō bē gōwišn ka nē gōwēd ēn kū šāyēd ayāb nē šāyēd ā-m nē rōšnag.
"At aṣ̌aiia.nō paiti.jamiiāt̰, the hāwanān has to stand up and recite xᵛarata narō. When he does not recite it, it is not clear to me whether this is allowed or not."

ab.ab: The assistant priest, standing in the Western direction, puts the third (piece of) wood (and) incense on the fire. Then, the assistant priest, standing on the chief priest’s left hand side, recites alone.

"The rāspī walks around the south side of the fire to the zōt, stands to the left of the zōt and directs his recitation of st. 2 to him: "O man, this food offering [i.e, the drōn] which has been prepared with purity and is before you, may you through your righteousness be worthy of tasting it" (khvarata narō aētem myazdem yōi dim hanghāne ashācha frērēticha)".
